ygData.subject: Strategy
ygData.msgSnippet: Eventually, all enchanters find out that their pet can t tank. I have developed a strategy which will prolong the life of our beloved pets and make our use of
ygData.messageBody:
Eventually, all enchanters find out that their pet can't tank. I have
developed a strategy which will prolong the life of our beloved pets and
make our use of mana more efficient. However, this will only work if the mob
you are soloing is not one of those "cons blue but hits like a red" types.
First, u tashan, then you do your Dot. Then, u wait for the pet to have half
hp, and then cast the big dd spell. This will draw the mob toward you. Here
is the most important part. You must begin running in a circle, hitting jump
every once in a while. The mob will chase u and hit u less then it woud if u
were standing in one place. While this is going on, your pet is getting free
hits on the mob and should quickly finish it. Note: as much as you'd want
to, do NOT use debuffs other than tashan. You must cast your 3 spells
quickly, before the pet gets so low on hp that the mob will finish it. Once
again, this will only work if the mob you are fighting is blue. You must
have an open area to work with, I'd say at least 15ft radius. I am currently
using this one in Lavastorm and its very mana efficient. Good luck.




-----Original Message-----
From: Shawn Alley <ShawnA@...>
To: 'eqenchanters@onelist.com' <eqenchanters@onelist.com>
Date: Thursday, December 02, 1999 4:54 PM
Subject: RE: [eqenchanters] Charmed creatures


>From: Shawn Alley <ShawnA@...>
>
>Oasis is great for orcs grouped and crocs solo
>So Ro would be good for the derv camps and drybones
>
>West Commons is good. Are wisps still blue at 12? think they are. The
derv
>camp would be good with a group and you would be helpful for them to
control
>bad pulls. Also with a small group can easily handle full kodiaks.
>
>Beholder would be ok for minos grouped and muddite minors solo
>
>The karanas (west I suppose) should have some bandits and the like
>
>Unrest would be pushing it for death beetles and tormented dead with a
>partner
>
>You'll notice I didn't mention much in the way of dungeons cause I like the
>open spaces. But befallen would probly be ok and if in a decent group
upper
>guk near the exit.
>
>Bertt Earneeless
>Povar
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Alex Kutsenok [mailto:kutsenok@...]
>Sent: Thursday, December 02, 1999 7:27 PM
>To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
>Subject: [eqenchanters] Charmed creatures
>
>
>From: "Alex Kutsenok" <kutsenok@...>
>
>I was wondering if charmed pets get exp when they kill something. Do they
>get it every time or just if they make the last hit? Any info would be
>appreciated.
>
>Also, I am a lvl12 enchanter and am wondering what sort of places I can
hunt
>at for the next few lvls. I am currently near No Ro and Oasis, but am
>thinking that there's got to be an alternative.
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Paul Jesernig <pwj@...>
>To: eqenchanters@onelist.com <eqenchanters@onelist.com>
>Date: Thursday, December 02, 1999 3:00 PM
>Subject: [eqenchanters] Jewelry skill cap
>
>
>>From: "Paul Jesernig" <pwj@...>
>>
>>Jewelry skill will cap at 200 so that no platinum items become trivial.
>>There is no level cap for trade skills. Main skills are capped at
>>(5xlevel)+5, but trade skills do not have this level limitation. Two
>>different meanings of skill caps. Hope this clears up the confusion.
>>
>>Lozi, CT
>>
>>>
>
>>
